Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Map

  • class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Map class, and uses an OpenSimplex noise function to generate 0s and 1s into a 2D array. The class also handles drawing a representation of the array onto a GraphicsContext.
    Version:
    0.3 (2017.01.20)
    Author:
    Kent Daleng

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[][] array 
      private static java.lang.String CANVAS 
      private Graphics graphics 
      private OpenSimplexNoise noise 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Map(Graphics graphics)
      Constructor for Map objects

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void drawMap()
      Draws the representation of our map onto a GraphicsContext, a 1 in the array will be a wall on the layer.
      private void drawMapCell(java.awt.Point point)
      Draws a single cell at a specific point
      (package private) int[][] getArr()
      Returns the map array
      (package private) int getValueAt(java.awt.Point point)
      Returns the value in the array at a specific point
      (package private) void populate()
      Generates a map based on the OpenSimplex noise function, where 1 represents a wall and 0 represents floor.
      (package private) void setValueAt(java.awt.Point point, int value)
      Sets the value at a certain point in the array, and draws the resulting graphical representation

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Map

        Map(Graphics graphics)
        Constructor for Map objects
        Parameters:
        graphics - a Graphics object to handle our graphics calls

    • Method Detail

      • populate

        void populate()
        Generates a map based on the OpenSimplex noise function, where 1 represents a wall and 0 represents floor.

      • setValueAt

        void setValueAt(java.awt.Point point,
                int value)
         throws OutOfBoundsException
        Sets the value at a certain point in the array, and draws the resulting graphical representation
        Parameters:
        point - a Point with array coordinates
        value - a value to set at the array position
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - if a point tries to access the map out of bounds, an error is thrown

      • drawMap

        void drawMap()
        Draws the representation of our map onto a GraphicsContext, a 1 in the array will be a wall on the layer.

      • drawMapCell

        private void drawMapCell(java.awt.Point point)
        Draws a single cell at a specific point
        Parameters:
        point - a point in the array coordinate system to draw at

      • getValueAt

        int getValueAt(java.awt.Point point)
        throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns the value in the array at a specific point
        Parameters:
        point - a Point at which the value should be returned
        Returns:
        an int representing the value in the specified cell
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - if a point tries to access the map out of bounds, an error is thrown

      • getArr

        int[][] getArr()
        Returns the map array
        Returns:
        an int[][] representing the map
